data.name: Furby
data.description: Furby is an American electronic robotic toy that was originally released in 1998 by Tiger Electronics.

data.name: Bop iT
data.description: The game was released worldwide in June 2016. The game has 3 main actions – Bop It, Twist It and Pull It and 10 actions that use a motion sensor.

data.name: Socker Boppers
data.description: Socker Boppers (formerly Sock'em Boppers) is a children's toy popularized in the late 1990s by Big Time Toys.

data.name: Tamagotchi
data.description: The Tamagotchi is a handheld digital pet that was created in Japan by Akihiro Yokoi. It was released on May 1, 1997 in the rest of the world

data.name: Sky Dancer
data.description: Sky Dancers is the name of a line of toys and an animated show spin-off that were popular in the mid-1990s.

data.name: PooChi
data.description: Poo-Chi (or Poochi, Poochie), one of the first generations of robopet toys, is a robot dog manufactured by Sega Toys, and distributed by Tiger Toys. Poo-Chi was released in 2000 and discontinued in 2002.

data.name: Gak Splat
data.description: Nickelodeon/Mattel's most popular compound[citation needed]; the product was inspired by the Nickelodeon show Double Dare. It made a fart noise when squeezed into its clear, star-shaped container.

data.name: Etch A Sketch
data.description: Etch A Sketch is a mechanical drawing toy invented by André Cassagnes of France. The Etch A Sketch was introduced near the peak of the Baby Boom on 12 July 1960 for $2.99.
